duties_responsibilities.duty: Plans, designs, and maintains Picture Archive and Computer Systems (PACS) or similar clinical image archiving and viewing solutions.
Implements and maintains PACS systems including image data maintenance, image archive and display.
Works with information technology to efficiently process data information.
Acts as a liaison between clinical staff, radiologists/cardiologists, and ordering physicians in system design.
Trains clinical staff and other users on system usage, acquisition, QC, display, and archival of electronic images.
Integrates PACS system to provide efficient image interpretation processes.
Performs other duties as requested by management.
Minimum three (3) years of experience in the clinical area.
Bachelor's degree in management information systems, health care management, radiological technology, or related field OR four (4) years of experience in a directly related field.
Demonstrated knowledge of radiology/cardiology information systems, word-processing, spreadsheet/graphics, and database applications.
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written, as well as the ability to vary communication according to the expertise of the user.
Demonstrated abilities in leadership, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Additional system experience may be substituted for the clinical experience.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in management information systems, health care management, radiological technology, or related field (Master's preferred)
